abstracts.cdata!:
The Integrated Drug Prevention Pilot
            Project as cancelled at the request of the Government of
            Argentina as of December 14, 2000. Due to the
            Government's delay in issuing the Presidential Decree
            455/99 required for loan signing, the Loan became effective
            in February 2000, nine months after the approval by the
            Bank. A presidential election, which took place during this
            period, left the Federal budget discussion for the
            Government's Fiscal Year 2000 incomplete, seriously
            affecting a number of activities including this project. The
            new Administration no longer considered this project a
            priority, replaced the initial Project Implementation Unit
            (PIU) in March 2000, and did not assemble the successor
            until the end of April 2000. A Bank mission visited
            Argentina during the week of June 19-23, 2000. The PIU
            proceeded with the implementation following the mission.
            However, the Government later came to a decision to cancel
            the project due to the ongoing fiscal crisis and the
            shifting of priorities by the new Administration.
